SEARCH
Module com.cab302.peerpractice
Package com.cab302.peerpractice.Controllers

Class BaseController

java.lang.Object
com.cab302.peerpractice.Controllers.BaseController
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditProfileController, ForgotPasswordController, GroupCalendarController, GroupChatController, GroupFileController, GroupSettingsController, InviteMemberController, LoginController, ManageGroupController, NotesController, PopupController, ResetPasswordController, SettingController, ShareGroupIDController, SidebarController, SignupController
public abstract class BaseController extends Object
Base controller providing common functionality for all controllers.

This abstract controller follows the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle by centralizing shared behavior and utility methods used across multiple controller classes in the application.

Key features include:

  • User session management and validation
  • Safe UI component value handling
  • Standardized alert dialog presentation
  • Common navigation and context access
See Also:

    • BaseController

  • Method Details

    • ensureLoggedIn

      protected User ensureLoggedIn()
      Ensures there is a logged-in user and returns it, or null if not logged in.

      This method checks the current user session and returns the authenticated user if available. It provides a centralized way to validate user authentication across all controllers.

      Returns:
      the currently logged-in User object, or null if no user is authenticated

    • safeSet

      protected static void safeSet(javafx.scene.control.TextField field, String value)
      Safely sets text field value, handling null values.

      This utility method prevents NullPointerExceptions by checking for null field references and converting null values to empty strings before setting text field content.

      Parameters:
      field - the TextField to set value for
      value - the string value to set (null values are converted to empty string)

    • trimOrEmpty

      protected static String trimOrEmpty(javafx.scene.control.TextField tf)
      Returns trimmed text from field or empty string if null.

      This utility method safely extracts and trims text from a TextField, providing a fallback empty string if the field or its text is null.

      Parameters:
      tf - the TextField to extract text from
      Returns:
      the trimmed text content, or empty string if field or text is null

    • showAlert

      protected void showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type, String header, String content, String title, javafx.scene.layout.Pane rootPane)
      Shows an alert dialog with standard styling.

      This method provides a consistent way to display alert dialogs throughout the application, with proper window ownership and standardized formatting.

      Parameters:
      type - the type of alert (e.g., INFORMATION, WARNING, ERROR)
      header - the header text to display in the alert
      content - the main content text of the alert
      title - the window title for the alert dialog
      rootPane - the parent pane for window ownership (can be null)
